name: Mint Coolangatta Points North Apartments

reviews.text: It's not a 5 star resort by any means. It has a worn, faded glory which they are only just starting to correct 20 years later (Oct 2011) by big renovations. When we visited they were working on corridor and foyers and the indoor pool. Unfortunately the serviced apartments are privately owned so it's a roulette deal as to whether the owner of the apartment you are allocated has dumped all their own crap furniture into the apartment, taken all the new tvs and appliances - or not. Luckily in this case the owner (of North Xanadu tower apartment 105) had recently purchased a new furniture package (sofa, beds, dining setting, 47" LCD tv etc) so we did fine. The furniture closely matches the publicity shots so hopefully all owners have had to shell out and buy this package (and not take it home).
reviews.title: Good family value

reviews.text: The apartment itself is big compared to most Gold Coast apartments. We got a 2 bedroom (2 adults 2 kids) - the living area was very large. Previous reviews had mentioned poor reception service - I tested them out on some slightly 'annoying' requests but they dealt with them fine.
reviews.title: Great family accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved our stay here! The location was perfect for our young family - directly across from Coollangatta Surf club and beach. The apartments are in the heart of town, a short stroll away from cafes and shops. The apartment we stayed in was beautifully fitted out, with enough space to spread out and relax. Our children loved the pool facilities and and mad us visit them every day. Will definitely choose to stay here again!!
reviews.title: Great view and location, spacious unit but a refurbish needed !

reviews.text: Reception: Good reception by counter staff, pleasant and informative.
reviews.title: Perfect location!

reviews.text: Car parking: Takes a while to get into the carpark via underground shopping car park, but is secure.
reviews.title: Worth it for the location alone

reviews.text: We stayed here for a week in a 3 bedroom (only used 2 of the rooms, the other was shut off). Charged for a 2 bedroom. The unit was enormous with the most amazing views forever. No street noise so high up and very convenietly located to Aldi and restaurants. Flat screen tv in lounge with modern furnishings and second flat screen in main bedroom. Huge kitchen with lots of extra equipment not normally found in holiday rentals. Highly recommended, we didn't want to leave!
reviews.title: Huge 3 bedroom with breathtaking views

reviews.text: We shared a 2 bedroom apartment on the 16th floor of this very well appointed property. Everything was in good order, and clean and well maintained. We will go back here for sure !
reviews.title: Views forever
Comfy family hotel, if not quite minty fresh
reviews.text: This apartment hotel ticks many boxes for family holidays with 2 young children: large sized apartments with bath, opposite the beach and playground, indestructible furnishings, access to a selection of pools of various depth, sizes and temperatures. Plus kids eat free at many of the overpriced eateries downstairs; and if that doesnt excite, the presence of an Aldi in the building will. The hotel is well into creaking middle age - apricot walls inside testify to an 80's heyday - but it is still comfy.

Location - perfect. Amazing beach views - we saw whales every day. 10 minutes from the airport, but barely any noise from planes. Walking distance to shops, movies, beach, playground, restaurants and buses to tweed heads, surfers and currumbin sanctuary.
reviews.title: Perfect for everything you need.

reviews.text: Rooms - comfy enough. Kitchen stocked with enough implements to cook with, although none of the extras other places have (eg salt and pepper etc). Beds comfy, but curtains not quite wide enough, resulting in a couple of 4am starts from our 2 year old. Might seem a small thing - but generous curtains make a huge difference, especially as QLD has no daylight savings. No cleaning unless you stay more than 1 week, but room was well stocked with broom, vacuum, washing machine etc.
reviews.title: Good value, location great, noise levels variable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was painless and quick, staff were pleasant and very helpful. Parking underground was free, a pleasant change.
reviews.title: Perfect for Coolangatta/Tweed

reviews.text: The rooms are large, the kitchen has all you need, living room is large and the bathrooms are also a good size and very clean.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: The location is perfect with a large shopping centre in the basement and all the restaurants and shops on the Coolangatta Strip a short walk away. We were lucky enough to have a high floor facing the beach and the view is magnificent.
reviews.title: Great views refurbishment required

reviews.text: The only down side is the one air conditioning unit for the whole apartment. It is enough for the living/kitchen area but the rooms miss out. It is impossible to have a rest/sleep in the bedrooms during the day or early evening, they get very hot facing the sun all day. Also, the mattresses are rock hard making for a very unpleasant sleep.
reviews.title: Roomy accomdation looking over the beach

reviews.text: Although I think it's a great stay, I wouldn't stay there again. We were there using it for a base to travel the area for a few days. If I went back with the family I would look elsewhere, not having a room for any babies/kids to have a sleep during the day would be a problem.
reviews.title: Good Quality Self Contained Apartments close to Airport & Beach

reviews.text: We stayed at Mint Coolangatta in January this year and found the apartment to be pretty good. A bit dated and tired in places (the taps are still circa 1980) and the pool is pretty basic, but overall it was a good stay and the resort was well managed.
reviews.title: Good Coolangatta apartments - but not new

reviews.text: Top location across from the beach. Great views.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in the heart of Coolangatta

reviews.text: Don't expect excellence, but it was good, reliable value for the price paid.
reviews.title: Comfortable - good for families

reviews.text: We have just spent 5 nights in a 2 bedroom apartment with our 2 kids (3 and 6). Room 77 on floor 13.
reviews.title: Very comfortable Unit, great location..Highly recommend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located right opposite the beach at Coolangatta and above a small shopping centre. The beach across the road is patrolled and has a park between the road and the sand. This park has kids play equipment and BBQs. The shopping centre has Aldi and various other shops. There are many different restaurants, cafes, ice cream shops and bars/pubs within a very easy walk of the hotel. The surf club was fantastic food, great price and an unbeatable view!!
reviews.title: Stunning view-dated furnishings & decor

description: Each fully self contained apartment features spacious balconies with stunning ocean or hinterland views and the resort features a choice of recreational facilities including a heated pool & spa, children’s wading pool, full size tennis court, games room and a choice of restaurants located right at your doorstep.The open plan living room provides space for everyone and the dining area opens onto balconies overlooking the beach or foreshore. Large bedrooms, a modern self contained kitchen and an internal laundry will provide guests with all the necessary facilities to make the apartment feel like it is a home away from home.The 4 bedroom penthouse also includes it’s own private rooftop pool, spa, sauna and BBQ. Each apartment has the following standard facilities:Spacious modern designLarge balconies with ocean viewsSecurity swipe accessIndividually controlled heating/coolingFully Self Contained Kitchen & LaundryCable TV including 20 Austar channels and DVD playerLarge bathrooms with shower and bath
